basic.description:
In this course we analyze business situations from the perspective of a general manager with overall responsibility for the firm, or for a business unit within the firm. Central to the course is the fact that ¿ in most business situations - the firm evolves in a competitive environment where the manager¿s actions affect, and are affected by, the actions of rivals. This has a fundamental impact on the way we make optimal decisions.
This course provides a conceptual framework and a set of simple ¿tools¿ to examine these situations; and emphasizes the application of these concepts to real business situations. As such it relies heavily on the analysis of case studies.
The course highlights simple techniques from applied game theory that are very useful for understanding a wide array of practical challenges facing the general manager in a competitive environment
basic.subject: COMM
basic.title: Decision-Making in Competitive Environments
